data.title: EastEnders' Natalie Cassidy 'preparing' for Sonia Fowler exit after 31 years on soap
data.meta_description: The EastEnders actress expressed her exit fears as she marks her 31st year playing Sonia Fowler.
data.text:
EastEnders legend Natalie Cassidy has admitted she regularly fears that her time as Sonia Fowler will come to an end and "prepares" herself to be axed. The 41-year-old actress joined the cast aged just 10 back in 1993 and has since gone on to become one of the soap's most recognisable characters, with two British Soap awards under her belt.

Since hitting the screens as a youngster, Sonia has been at the centre of the some of the biggest storylines from teenage pregnancy, love affairs, a cancer scare and most recently her difficult IVF journey.

With being such an iconic character on Albert Square, Natalie said fans often assume that her role is safe but stressed that this isn't the case. Getting candid about her future on the soap, she shared: "One day, you know, I'm sure Sonia will end.

"I don't know when, hopefully she will potter about being a nurse for a bit longer. I don't want her to die a terrible death, I don't want her to get run over or pushed in Walford train station."

Quizzed further about soap producers sometimes making sudden changes to big characters, the actress explained: "To be honest, it's got to evolve and characters have to come and go because otherwise it will be a very boring place. You have different people come in with different ideas.

Read More... Countryfile Adam Henson's family heartbreak from famous dad to baby scandal

"And yeah, of course you're upset if you lose a friend from somewhere but it's the same with any job and moving on," she continued on Sophie Ellis-Bextor's Spinning Plates podcast.

Natalie has dipped in and out of the soap over the years due to exploring other opportunities and focusing on motherhood, but has always been welcomed back by producers.

Not one to be complacent however, the actress said receiving a new contract didn't always give her hope and instead sparked exit fears.

She continued: "Genuinely, it's not a joke, every contract that comes round for me in my head I think, 'Oh, I'm going then'. I have to think, 'Oh I'm going to be leaving then' because I could be gone, definitely gone.

Don't Miss...

Graham Norton was 'left for dead' after Eurovision host was stabbed in attack [REVEALED]

Eurovision winner Nemo shows true colours as runner cleans their shoes for them [WATCH]

We use your sign-up to provide content in ways you've consented to and to improve our understanding of you. This may include adverts from us and 3rd parties based on our understanding. You can unsubscribe at any time. Read our Privacy Policy

"People say, 'You're never going to go' and I'm like, 'Well never say never to anything'.

"There's always people in soaps with shock exits or if they want to do a big story with someone people care about.

"I'm always prepared for that and that's fine, you've just got to enjoy it while it lasts."

In 2006, Natalie took a step back to appear in a variety of theatre shows including The Vagina Monologues, Bedroom Farce, Gertrude's Secret, as well as The Cherry Orchard alongside the late Diana Rigg.

Three years later, she reprised her role as Sonia with her on-screen family including Lindsey Coulson as Carol Jackson, Dean Gaffney as Robbie Jackson and Devon Anderson as Billie Jackson.

In 2010, she explored further opportunities again and fronted her own reality television show before becoming a contestant on Strictly Come Dancing followed by Celebrity Big Brother.

Four years on, EastEnders announced that Natalie had decided to make a permanent return to the soap.

With the exception of her maternity leave from 2016 to 2017, she has appeared as a regular ever since.

EastEnders continues tonight at 7.30pm on BBC One.
